nodes.bodyText:
So... for all the other extensions, it was decided to add the description to the runtime pom.xml. (my personal preference would have been to do it as you did but it was decided differently)
Also aren't the description far too long for code.quarkus.io? @ia3andy ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,3 +14,4 @@ metadata:
   - "web"
   - "reactive"
   status: "experimental"
+description: "Jackson integration for RESTEasy Reactive. This extension is not compatible with the quarkus-resteasy extension, or any of the extensions that depend on it."

nodes.bodyText:
I really don't care TBH :).
Up to you'all to decide

maven repositories, but @maxandersen seemed to want it here.. any reason?

nodes.bodyText: Yes, this information should be in the pom.xml. I am not 100% sure but I think it is ignored on this YAML or overriden from the pom (which reads from the parent)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,3 +14,4 @@ metadata:
   - "web"
   - "reactive"
   status: "experimental"
+description: "Jackson integration for RESTEasy Reactive. This extension is not compatible with the quarkus-resteasy extension, or any of the extensions that depend on it."

nodes.bodyText:
No gsmet. I fought that it should be necessary to duplicate information, minimal maintance/setup for extension writers and that the info in Pom.xml is used on other sites too (think search.maven.org).
Thus we said that the Pom.xml is the default fallback so only those who want to maintain duplicate text blocks or like in this case add some additional info are burdened with it.

nodes.bodyText:
I think we need the basic information in the pom and the whole stuff with incompatibilities in the yaml.
IIRC, the Yaml has precedence over the pom.xml. That way the incompatibility sentence will only appear for code.quarkus.io and we would have some info in Maven anyway.
Does it make sense?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,3 +14,4 @@ metadata:

   status: "experimental"
+description: "Jackson integration for RESTEasy Reactive. This extension is not compatible with the quarkus-resteasy extension, or any of the extensions that depend on it."
